newsitem.title: USA: Auto sales in U.S. off 12.9 pct June 1-10 -- CNW.
newsitem.headline: Auto sales in U.S. off 12.9 pct June 1-10 -- CNW.

text.p: Auto sales in the United States fell 12.9 percent in the first 10 days of June compared with the same period a year ago, according to a report by CNW Marketing/Research.
During the survey period, sales of domestic autos slumped 12.5 percent, and U.S. sales of imports sunk 15.6 percent.
Specifically, domestic car sales fell 16.1 percent, to 191,864 from 228,643, CNW said. Domestic truck sales fell 8.4 percent, to 184,548 from 201,374, it said.
Import car sales declined 16.0 percent to 51,705, and import truck sales fell 13.9 percent to 10,998, the report said.
Year-to-date, vehicle sales in the United States reached 6,781,895, off 1.2 percent from the same period of 1996, according to CNW.
